code:
export const NEWS_DATA = [{
  year: 1947,
  title: "India Achieves Independence; Flag Hoisted at Fort St. George",
  summary: "On August 15, 1947, India gained independence. In Madras, the first Premier of the province, O. P. Ramaswamy Reddiyar, hoisted the national flag at Fort St. George.",
  source_name: "Historical Archives",
  source_url: "(General historical record)",
  rank: 1
}, {
  year: 1947,
  title: "Madras Temple Entry Authorization Act Passed",
  summary: "The government passed the Madras Temple Entry Authorization Act, 1947, a landmark social reform. It legally granted all classes of Hindus, including Dalits, the right to enter Hindu temples.",
  source_name: "Legislative Records",
  source_url: "(General legislative record)",
  rank: 2
}, {
  year: 1947,
  title: "Devadasi Dedication Abolition Act Enacted",
  summary: "The government passed the Madras Devadasi (Prevention of Dedication) Act, which outlawed the practice of dedicating girls to Hindu temples as 'Devadasis', a major social reform.",
  source_name: "Legislative Records",
  source_url: "(General legislative record)",
  rank: 3
}, {
  year: 1947,
  title: "M.G. Ramachandran Debuts as Hero in 'Rajakumari'",
  summary: "M.G. Ramachandran (MGR) starred in his first lead role in the film Rajakumari. This marked the beginning of his ascent as a cultural icon, which would later become foundational to the Dravidian political movement.",
  source_name: "Film History Archives",
  source_url: "(General film history)",
  rank: 4
}, {
  year: 1947,
  title: "Famine Scars and Food Scarcity",
  summary: "The state, still recovering from the 1946 famine, faced severe food scarcity. The government promoted wheat as an alternative to rice and temporarily banned serving rice-based foods like idlis in hotels.",
  source_name: "The Hindu Archives",
  source_url: "(General news archives)",
  rank: 5
}, {
  year: 1948,
  title: "Madras Public Libraries Act Passed",
  summary: "The state passed the Madras Public Libraries Act, the first of its kind in India. It established a structured framework for a public library system, with the Connemara Public Library designated as the State Central Library.",
  source_name: "Legislative Records",
  source_url: "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Madras_Public_Libraries_Act",
  rank: 1
}, {
  year: 1948,
  title: "First Government-Owned Airplane Purchased",
  summary: "The Madras government, under Premier O. P. Ramaswamy Reddiyar, became the first in India to purchase its own aircraft, a de Havilland Dove, for official administrative travel.",
  source_name: "The Hindu",
  source_url: "https://www.thehindu.com/news/national/tamil-nadu/the-governments-first-plane/article596165.ece",
  rank: 2
}, {
  year: 1948,
  title: "Gandhi Assassination Shocks Madras",
  summary: "The assassination of Mahatma Gandhi on January 30, 1948, led to widespread mourning and hartals (strikes) across Madras State, as in the rest of the nation.",
  source_name: "Historical News Archives",
  source_url: "(General news archives)",
  rank: 3
}, {
  year: 1948,
  title: "'Naam Iruvar' Film Released",
  summary: "The film Naam Iruvar was released, becoming a major cultural event. It was known for its patriotic songs by Subramania Bharati and is seen as an early example of using cinema for social and political messaging.",
  source_name: "Film History Archives",
  source_url: "(General film history)",
  rank: 4
}, {
  year: 1948,
  title: "Political Rivalry in Congress",
  summary: "Internal power struggles within the Congress party intensified. K. Kamaraj successfully supported O. P. Ramaswamy Reddiyar against T. Prakasam for the party leadership, solidifying his own role as a key \"kingmaker.\"",
  source_name: "Political History Records",
  source_url: "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/O._P._Ramaswamy_Reddiyar",
  rank: 5
}, {
  year: 1949,
  title: "Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) is Formed",
  summary: "On September 17, 1949, C. N. Annadurai, M. Karunanidhi, and others split from E.V. Ramasamy's Dravidar Kazhagam (DK) to form the DMK, a pivotal event that would reshape state politics.",
  source_name: "Political History Records",
  source_url: "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dravida_Munnetra_Kazhagam",
  rank: 1
}, {
  year: 1949,
  title: "P. S. Kumaraswamy Raja Becomes Premier",
  summary: "Following O. P. Ramaswamy Reddiyar's resignation after losing party support, P. S. Kumaraswamy Raja took over as the last Premier of Madras Presidency on April 6.",
  source_name: "Government of Tamil Nadu Archives",
  source_url: "(General historical record)",
  rank: 2
}, {
  year: 1949,
  title: "Agitation for 'Greater Andhra'",
  summary: "The demand for a separate Telugu-speaking state, \"Andhra,\" with Madras city as its capital, gained significant momentum, leading to statewide agitations and political debates.",
  source_name: "Historical Archives",
  source_url: "(General historical record)",
  rank: 3
}, {
  year: 1949,
  title: "'Velaikaari' Film Released",
  summary: "The film Velaikaari, with a screenplay written by C. N. Annadurai, was released. It was a hugely successful film that effectively propagated the rationalist and social reform ideals of the nascent DMK.",
  source_name: "Film History Archives",
  source_url: "(General film history)",
  rank: 4
}, {
  year: 1949,
  title: "Abolition of Zamindari System",
  summary: "The state government passed the Madras Estate (Abolition and Conversion into Ryotwari) Act, 1948, which came into force in 1949. This landmark law abolished the old Zamindari system, ending feudal land ownership and transferring rights to the cultivators.",
  source_name: "Legislative Records",
  source_url: "(General legislative record)",
  rank: 5
}, {
  year: 1950,
  title: "Madras Presidency Becomes \"Madras State\"",
  summary: "On January 26, 1950, with the adoption of the Constitution of India, the \"Madras Presidency\" was officially renamed \"Madras State,\" becoming a constituent state of the Indian republic.",
  source_name: "Constitution of India",
  source_url: "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Madras_State",
  rank: 1
}, {
  year: 1950,
  title: "Republic Day Celebrations",
  summary: "The first Republic Day was celebrated with great pomp. P. S. Kumaraswamy Raja, now the Chief Minister, unfurled the national flag and took the salute at the Island Grounds in Madras.",
  source_name: "News Archives",
  source_url: "(General news archives)",
  rank: 2
}, {
  year: 1950,
  title: "'Ezhai Padum Padu' Film Released",
  summary: "The film Ezhai Padum Padu (The Plight of the Poor), an adaptation of Les Mis√©rables, was released. It was a major box office hit and cultural event, noted for its themes of social justice and poverty.",
  source_name: "Film History Archives",
  source_url: "(General film history)",
  rank: 3
}, {
  year: 1950,
  title: "Rise of Communist Movements",
  summary: "This period saw a significant rise in communist activities, particularly in the Tanjore district. The movements led agitations for land rights and better wages for tenant farmers and laborers.",
  source_name: "Political History Records",
  source_url: "(General historical record)",
  rank: 4
}, {
  year: 1950,
  title: "Food Controls and Rationing",
  summary: "Post-war food scarcity continued to be a major issue. The government maintained and enforced strict price controls and rationing of essential commodities like rice and sugar across the state.",
  source_name: "News Archives",
  source_url: "(General news archives)",
  rank: 5
}, {
  year: 2006,
  title: "DMK Returns to Power with Minority Government",
  summary: "In the assembly elections, the DMK-led alliance won, but the DMK itself fell short of a majority, securing 96 seats. M. Karunanidhi became Chief Minister for the fifth time, heading a minority government supported by allies like the Congress from the outside.",
  source_name: "Election Commission Archives",
  source_url: "(General ECI records)",
  rank: 1
}, {
  year: 2006,
  title: "Free Colour TV Scheme Launched",
  summary: "Fulfilling a major and controversial election promise, the new DMK government launched the scheme to distribute free colour television sets to households that did not own one.",
  source_name: "Government Orders / News Archives",
  source_url: "(General news archives)",
  rank: 2
}, {
  year: 2006,
  title: "Introduction of Rs 2/kg Rice Scheme",
  summary: "Another key election promise implemented was the provision of rice at Rs 2 per kilogram through the Public Distribution System (PDS), aimed at ensuring food security for the poor.",
  source_name: "Government Orders",
  source_url: "(General government records)",
  rank: 3
}, {
  year: 2006,
  title: "Formation of DMDK by Vijayakanth",
  summary: "Actor Vijayakanth formally launched his political party, the Desiya Murpokku Dravida Kazhagam (DMDK), positioning it as an alternative to both DMK and AIADMK. The party secured a significant vote share (around 8%) in its debut election, winning one seat.",
  source_name: "Political History Records",
  source_url: "(General historical record)",
  rank: 4
}, {
  year: 2006,
  title: "Setusamudram Shipping Canal Project Controversy",
  summary: "The Setusamudram project, aimed at creating a shipping channel through the Palk Strait, faced intensified opposition from environmental groups and Hindu religious organizations concerned about its impact on the marine ecosystem and the Ram Setu (Adam's Bridge).",
  source_name: "News Archives",
  source_url: "(General news archives)",
  rank: 5
}, {
  year: 2024,
  title: "Kallakurichi Hooch Tragedy Claims Over 60 Lives",
  summary: "Over 60 died in Kallakurichi (June) after consuming illicit liquor; led to admin action & probe.",
  source_name: "News Archives",
  source_url: "(General news archives)",
  rank: 1
}, {
  year: 2024,
  title: "Cyclone Fengal Causes Widespread Damage",
  summary: "Cyclone Fengal hit TN & Puducherry coast, causing significant damage & loss of life.",
  source_name: "Disaster Management / News Archives",
  source_url: "(General news archives)",
  rank: 2
}, {
  year: 2024,
  title: "DMK-Led Alliance Sweeps Lok Sabha Polls Again",
  summary: "DMK-led INDIA bloc won all 39+1 seats in TN & Puducherry in Lok Sabha polls.",
  source_name: "Election Commission Archives",
  source_url: "(General ECI records)",
  rank: 3
}, {
  year: 2024,
  title: "Chennai's D. Gukesh Becomes Youngest World Chess Champion",
  summary: "18-year-old D. Gukesh became youngest World Chess Champion.",
  source_name: "FIDE / News Archives",
  source_url: "(General news archives)",
  rank: 4
}, {
  year: 2024,
  title: "Actor Vijay Launches Political Party 'Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam'",
  summary: "Actor Vijay launched TVK party, announcing plans to contest 2026 assembly elections.",
  source_name: "News Archives",
  source_url: "(General news archives)",
  rank: 5
}, {
  year: 2025,
  title: "Heavy Northeast Monsoon Rains Cause Flooding",
  summary: "Extreme Oct rains led to flooding in several districts, crop damage, school holidays.",

  source_url: "(Current news reports)",
  rank: 1
}, {
  year: 2025,
  title: "Preparations for 2026 Assembly Elections Begin",
  summary: "Political parties began groundwork & initial alliance talks for 2026 State Assembly elections.",
  source_name: "Political News Analysis",
  source_url: "(Current news reports)",
  rank: 2
}, {
  year: 2025,
  title: "Focus on State's Economic Growth and Investment",
  summary: "Govt continued push for industrial investment (EVs, semiconductors); StartupTN reported ecosystem growth.",
  source_name: "Government Reports / Business News",
  source_url: "(Current news reports)",
  rank: 3
}, {
  year: 2025,
  title: "Ongoing Debates on Governor's Role",

  source_url: "(Current news reports)",
  rank: 4

  year: 2025,
  title: "Infrastructure Projects (Metro Phase II, Airport Expansion) Progress",
  summary: "Work continued on major projects like Chennai Metro Phase II, Parandur airport proposal.",
  source_name: "Government Reports / News Archives",
  source_url: "(Current news reports)",

sourcesContent:
export const NEWS_DATA = [
  { year: 1947, title: "India Achieves Independence; Flag Hoisted at Fort St. George", summary: "On August 15, 1947, India gained independence. In Madras, the first Premier of the province, O. P. Ramaswamy Reddiyar, hoisted the national flag at Fort St. George.", source_name: "Historical Archives", source_url: "(General historical record)", rank: 1 },
  { year: 1947, title: "Madras Temple Entry Authorization Act Passed", summary: "The government passed the Madras Temple Entry Authorization Act, 1947, a landmark social reform. It legally granted all classes of Hindus, including Dalits, the right to enter Hindu temples.", source_name: "Legislative Records", source_url: "(General legislative record)", rank: 2 },
  { year: 1947, title: "Devadasi Dedication Abolition Act Enacted", summary: "The government passed the Madras Devadasi (Prevention of Dedication) Act, which outlawed the practice of dedicating girls to Hindu temples as 'Devadasis', a major social reform.", source_name: "Legislative Records", source_url: "(General legislative record)", rank: 3 },
  { year: 1947, title: "M.G. Ramachandran Debuts as Hero in 'Rajakumari'", summary: "M.G. Ramachandran (MGR) starred in his first lead role in the film Rajakumari. This marked the beginning of his ascent as a cultural icon, which would later become foundational to the Dravidian political movement.", source_name: "Film History Archives", source_url: "(General film history)", rank: 4 },
  { year: 1947, title: "Famine Scars and Food Scarcity", summary: "The state, still recovering from the 1946 famine, faced severe food scarcity. The government promoted wheat as an alternative to rice and temporarily banned serving rice-based foods like idlis in hotels.", source_name: "The Hindu Archives", source_url: "(General news archives)", rank: 5 },
  { year: 1948, title: "Madras Public Libraries Act Passed", summary: "The state passed the Madras Public Libraries Act, the first of its kind in India. It established a structured framework for a public library system, with the Connemara Public Library designated as the State Central Library.", source_name: "Legislative Records", source_url: "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Madras_Public_Libraries_Act", rank: 1 },
  { year: 1948, title: "First Government-Owned Airplane Purchased", summary: "The Madras government, under Premier O. P. Ramaswamy Reddiyar, became the first in India to purchase its own aircraft, a de Havilland Dove, for official administrative travel.", source_name: "The Hindu", source_url: "https://www.thehindu.com/news/national/tamil-nadu/the-governments-first-plane/article596165.ece", rank: 2 },
  { year: 1948, title: "Gandhi Assassination Shocks Madras", summary: "The assassination of Mahatma Gandhi on January 30, 1948, led to widespread mourning and hartals (strikes) across Madras State, as in the rest of the nation.", source_name: "Historical News Archives", source_url: "(General news archives)", rank: 3 },
  { year: 1948, title: "'Naam Iruvar' Film Released", summary: "The film Naam Iruvar was released, becoming a major cultural event. It was known for its patriotic songs by Subramania Bharati and is seen as an early example of using cinema for social and political messaging.", source_name: "Film History Archives", source_url: "(General film history)", rank: 4 },
  { year: 1948, title: "Political Rivalry in Congress", summary: "Internal power struggles within the Congress party intensified. K. Kamaraj successfully supported O. P. Ramaswamy Reddiyar against T. Prakasam for the party leadership, solidifying his own role as a key \"kingmaker.\"", source_name: "Political History Records", source_url: "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/O._P._Ramaswamy_Reddiyar", rank: 5 },
  { year: 1949, title: "Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) is Formed", summary: "On September 17, 1949, C. N. Annadurai, M. Karunanidhi, and others split from E.V. Ramasamy's Dravidar Kazhagam (DK) to form the DMK, a pivotal event that would reshape state politics.", source_name: "Political History Records", source_url: "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dravida_Munnetra_Kazhagam", rank: 1 },
  { year: 1949, title: "P. S. Kumaraswamy Raja Becomes Premier", summary: "Following O. P. Ramaswamy Reddiyar's resignation after losing party support, P. S. Kumaraswamy Raja took over as the last Premier of Madras Presidency on April 6.", source_name: "Government of Tamil Nadu Archives", source_url: "(General historical record)", rank: 2 },
  { year: 1949, title: "Agitation for 'Greater Andhra'", summary: "The demand for a separate Telugu-speaking state, \"Andhra,\" with Madras city as its capital, gained significant momentum, leading to statewide agitations and political debates.", source_name: "Historical Archives", source_url: "(General historical record)", rank: 3 },
  { year: 1949, title: "'Velaikaari' Film Released", summary: "The film Velaikaari, with a screenplay written by C. N. Annadurai, was released. It was a hugely successful film that effectively propagated the rationalist and social reform ideals of the nascent DMK.", source_name: "Film History Archives", source_url: "(General film history)", rank: 4 },
  { year: 1949, title: "Abolition of Zamindari System", summary: "The state government passed the Madras Estate (Abolition and Conversion into Ryotwari) Act, 1948, which came into force in 1949. This landmark law abolished the old Zamindari system, ending feudal land ownership and transferring rights to the cultivators.", source_name: "Legislative Records", source_url: "(General legislative record)", rank: 5 },
  { year: 1950, title: "Madras Presidency Becomes \"Madras State\"", summary: "On January 26, 1950, with the adoption of the Constitution of India, the \"Madras Presidency\" was officially renamed \"Madras State,\" becoming a constituent state of the Indian republic.", source_name: "Constitution of India", source_url: "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Madras_State", rank: 1 },
  { year: 1950, title: "Republic Day Celebrations", summary: "The first Republic Day was celebrated with great pomp. P. S. Kumaraswamy Raja, now the Chief Minister, unfurled the national flag and took the salute at the Island Grounds in Madras.", source_name: "News Archives", source_url: "(General news archives)", rank: 2 },
  { year: 1950, title: "'Ezhai Padum Padu' Film Released", summary: "The film Ezhai Padum Padu (The Plight of the Poor), an adaptation of Les Mis√©rables, was released. It was a major box office hit and cultural event, noted for its themes of social justice and poverty.", source_name: "Film History Archives", source_url: "(General film history)", rank: 3 },
  { year: 1950, title: "Rise of Communist Movements", summary: "This period saw a significant rise in communist activities, particularly in the Tanjore district. The movements led agitations for land rights and better wages for tenant farmers and laborers.", source_name: "Political History Records", source_url: "(General historical record)", rank: 4 },
  { year: 1950, title: "Food Controls and Rationing", summary: "Post-war food scarcity continued to be a major issue. The government maintained and enforced strict price controls and rationing of essential commodities like rice and sugar across the state.", source_name: "News Archives", source_url: "(General news archives)", rank: 5 },
  { year: 2006, title: "DMK Returns to Power with Minority Government", summary: "In the assembly elections, the DMK-led alliance won, but the DMK itself fell short of a majority, securing 96 seats. M. Karunanidhi became Chief Minister for the fifth time, heading a minority government supported by allies like the Congress from the outside.", source_name: "Election Commission Archives", source_url: "(General ECI records)", rank: 1 },
  { year: 2006, title: "Free Colour TV Scheme Launched", summary: "Fulfilling a major and controversial election promise, the new DMK government launched the scheme to distribute free colour television sets to households that did not own one.", source_name: "Government Orders / News Archives", source_url: "(General news archives)", rank: 2 },
  { year: 2006, title: "Introduction of Rs 2/kg Rice Scheme", summary: "Another key election promise implemented was the provision of rice at Rs 2 per kilogram through the Public Distribution System (PDS), aimed at ensuring food security for the poor.", source_name: "Government Orders", source_url: "(General government records)", rank: 3 },
  { year: 2006, title: "Formation of DMDK by Vijayakanth", summary: "Actor Vijayakanth formally launched his political party, the Desiya Murpokku Dravida Kazhagam (DMDK), positioning it as an alternative to both DMK and AIADMK. The party secured a significant vote share (around 8%) in its debut election, winning one seat.", source_name: "Political History Records", source_url: "(General historical record)", rank: 4 },
  { year: 2006, title: "Setusamudram Shipping Canal Project Controversy", summary: "The Setusamudram project, aimed at creating a shipping channel through the Palk Strait, faced intensified opposition from environmental groups and Hindu religious organizations concerned about its impact on the marine ecosystem and the Ram Setu (Adam's Bridge).", source_name: "News Archives", source_url: "(General news archives)", rank: 5 },
  { year: 2024, title: "Kallakurichi Hooch Tragedy Claims Over 60 Lives", summary: "Over 60 died in Kallakurichi (June) after consuming illicit liquor; led to admin action & probe.", source_name: "News Archives", source_url: "(General news archives)", rank: 1 },
  { year: 2024, title: "Cyclone Fengal Causes Widespread Damage", summary: "Cyclone Fengal hit TN & Puducherry coast, causing significant damage & loss of life.", source_name: "Disaster Management / News Archives", source_url: "(General news archives)", rank: 2 },
  { year: 2024, title: "DMK-Led Alliance Sweeps Lok Sabha Polls Again", summary: "DMK-led INDIA bloc won all 39+1 seats in TN & Puducherry in Lok Sabha polls.", source_name: "Election Commission Archives", source_url: "(General ECI records)", rank: 3 },
  { year: 2024, title: "Chennai's D. Gukesh Becomes Youngest World Chess Champion", summary: "18-year-old D. Gukesh became youngest World Chess Champion.", source_name: "FIDE / News Archives", source_url: "(General news archives)", rank: 4 },
  { year: 2024, title: "Actor Vijay Launches Political Party 'Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam'", summary: "Actor Vijay launched TVK party, announcing plans to contest 2026 assembly elections.", source_name: "News Archives", source_url: "(General news archives)", rank: 5 },
  { year: 2025, title: "Heavy Northeast Monsoon Rains Cause Flooding", summary: "Extreme Oct rains led to flooding in several districts, crop damage, school holidays.", source_name: "News Archives / IMD Reports", source_url: "(Current news reports)", rank: 1 },
  { year: 2025, title: "Preparations for 2026 Assembly Elections Begin", summary: "Political parties began groundwork & initial alliance talks for 2026 State Assembly elections.", source_name: "Political News Analysis", source_url: "(Current news reports)", rank: 2 },
  { year: 2025, title: "Focus on State's Economic Growth and Investment", summary: "Govt continued push for industrial investment (EVs, semiconductors); StartupTN reported ecosystem growth.", source_name: "Government Reports / Business News", source_url: "(Current news reports)", rank: 3 },
  { year: 2025, title: "Ongoing Debates on Governor's Role", summary: "Relationship between state govt & Governor remained point of contention over bills/remarks.", source_name: "Political News Analysis", source_url: "(Current news reports)", rank: 4 },
  { year: 2025, title: "Infrastructure Projects (Metro Phase II, Airport Expansion) Progress", summary: "Work continued on major projects like Chennai Metro Phase II, Parandur airport proposal.", source_name: "Government Reports / News Archives", source_url: "(Current news reports)", rank: 5 }
];
